00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include "geodesy.h"
00043 
00044 int main( int argc, char* argv[] )
00045 {
00046   const int min_nr_args = 4;
00047   int ellipse=0;
00048   int fn_choice=0;
00049   GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse = GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84;
00050   FILE* fid=NULL;
00051   BOOL result = FALSE;
00052   BOOL echo_on = FALSE;
00053 
00054   if( argc < min_nr_args )
00055   {
00056     printf("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN\nUSAGE\n");
00057     printf("geodesy.bin <ellipse> <function> <outputfile> <additional arguments for function ... >\n");
00058     printf("\nellipse:\n");
00059     printf("0,   WGS84\n");
00060     printf("1,   Airy 1830\n");
00061     printf("2,   Modified Airy\n");
00062     printf("3,   Australian National\n");
00063     printf("4,   Bessel 1841\n");
00064     printf("5,   Clarke 1866\n");
00065     printf("6,   Clarke 1880\n");
00066     printf("7,   Everest(India 1830)\n");
00067     printf("8,   Everest(Brunei & E.Malaysia)\n");
00068     printf("9,   Everest(W.Malaysia & Singapore)\n");
00069     printf("10,  Geodetic Reference System 1980\n");
00070     printf("11,  Helmert 1906\n");
00071     printf("12,  Hough 1960\n");
00072     printf("13,  International 1924\n");
00073     printf("14,  South American 1969\n");
00074     printf("15,  World Geodetic System 1972\n");
00075 
00076     printf("\nfunction:\n");
00077     printf("0, GetReferenceEllipseParameters\n");
00078     printf("   requires no additions arguments\n");
00079     printf("1, ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates\n");
00080     printf("   latitude[rad], longitude[rad], height[m]\n");
00081     printf("2, ConvertEarthFixedCartesianToGeodeticCurvilinearCoordinates\n");
00082     printf("   userX[m], userY[m], userZ[m]\n");
00083     printf("3, ComputeNorthingEastingVertical\n");
00084     printf("   ref_lat[rad], ref_lon[rad], ref_hgt[m], lat[rad], lon[rad], hgt[m]\n");
00085     printf("4  ComputeAzimuthAndElevationAnglesBetweenToPointsInTheEarthFixedFrame\n" );
00086     printf("   fromX[m], fromY[m], fromZ[m], toX[m], toY[m], toZ[m]\n" );
00087 
00088     printf("\n\nAll output in base units. i.e. metres, radians, etc\n" );
00089     return 0;
00090   }
00091 
00092   ellipse = atoi(argv[1]);
00093   if( ellipse > 15 )
00094   { 
00095     perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::Invalid ellipse argument\n");
00096     return 1;
00097   }
00098   referenceEllipse = (GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse)ellipse;
00099 
00100   fn_choice = atoi(argv[2]);
00101   if( fn_choice < 0 || fn_choice > 4 )
00102   { 
00103     perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::Invalid function argument\n");
00104     return 1;
00105   }
00106 
00107 
00108   // Check the number of required arguments
00109   switch(fn_choice)
00110   {
00111     case 0: break;
00112     case 1: if( argc !=  7 ){ perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::Invalid function arguments\n"); return 1; } break;
00113     case 4: if( argc != 10 ){ perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::Invalid function arguments\n"); return 1; } break;
00114     default: break;
00115   }
00116 
00117   fid = fopen( argv[3], "w" );
00118   if( fid == NULL )
00119   {
00120     perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::Invalid output file argument\n");
00121     return 1;
00122   }  
00123 
00124   
00125 
00126   switch(fn_choice)
00127   {
00128     case 0: 
00129     {
00130       double a;      //!< semi-major axis of the reference ellipse                     [m]
00131       double b;      //!< semi-minor axis of the reference ellipse (b = a - a*f_inv)   [m] 
00132       double f_inv;  //!< inverse of the flattening of the reference ellipse           []
00133       double e2;     //!< eccentricity of the reference ellipse (e2 = (a*a-b*b)/(a*a)) [] 
00134 
00135       result = GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters( referenceEllipse, //!< reference ellipse enumerated    []
00136         &a,      //!< semi-major axis of the reference ellipse                     [m]
00137         &b,      //!< semi-minor axis of the reference ellipse (b = a - a*f_inv)   [m] 
00138         &f_inv,  //!< inverse of the flattening of the reference ellipse           []
00139         &e2      //!< eccentricity of the reference ellipse (e2 = (a*a-b*b)/(a*a)) [] 
00140       );
00141 
00142       if( result == TRUE )
00143       {
00144         if( echo_on )
00145         {
00146           printf( "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters\n" );
00147           printf( "ellipse = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00148           printf( "a       = %20.3f\n", a );
00149           printf( "b       = %20.9f\n", b );
00150           printf( "f_inv   = %20.11f\n", f_inv );
00151           printf( "e2      = %.15f\n\n", e2 );
00152         }
00153 
00154         fprintf( fid, "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters\n" );
00155         fprintf( fid, "ellipse = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00156         fprintf( fid, "a       = %20.3f\n", a );
00157         fprintf( fid, "b       = %20.9f\n", b );
00158         fprintf( fid, "f_inv   = %20.11f\n", f_inv );
00159         fprintf( fid, "e2      = %.15f\n\n", e2 );
00160       }        
00161       else
00162       { 
00163         perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters returned FALSE\n");
00164       }      
00165       break;
00166     }
00167     case 1: 
00168     {
00169       double latitude;   //!< geodetic latitude                [rad]
00170       double longitude;  //!< geodetic longitude               [rad]
00171       double height;     //!< geodetic height                  [m]
00172       double x;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00173       double y;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00174       double z;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00175 
00176       latitude  = atof( argv[4] );
00177       longitude = atof( argv[5] );
00178       height    = atof( argv[6] );
00179 
00180       result = GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates(
00181         referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00182         latitude,   //!< geodetic latitude                [rad]
00183         longitude,  //!< geodetic longitude               [rad]
00184         height,     //!< geodetic height                  [m]
00185         &x,               //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00186         &y,               //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00187         &z                //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00188       );
00189       if( result == TRUE )
00190       {
00191         if( echo_on )
00192         { 
00193           printf( "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates\n" );
00194           printf( "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00195           printf( "latitude  = %.12lf\n", latitude );
00196           printf( "longitude = %.12lf\n", longitude );
00197           printf( "height    = %.4lf\n", height );
00198           printf( "x         = %.4lf\n", x );
00199           printf( "y         = %.4lf\n", y );
00200           printf( "z         = %.4lf\n\n", z );
00201         }
00202 
00203         fprintf( fid, "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates\n" );
00204         fprintf( fid, "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00205         fprintf( fid, "latitude  = %.12lf\n", latitude );
00206         fprintf( fid, "longitude = %.12lf\n", longitude );
00207         fprintf( fid, "height    = %.4lf\n", height );
00208         fprintf( fid, "x         = %.4lf\n", x );
00209         fprintf( fid, "y         = %.4lf\n", y );
00210         fprintf( fid, "z         = %.4lf\n\n", z );
00211       }        
00212       else
00213       { 
00214         perror("GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates returned FALSE\n");
00215       }      
00216       break;
00217     }
00218     case 2:
00219     {
00220       double latitude;   //!< geodetic latitude                [rad]
00221       double longitude;  //!< geodetic longitude               [rad]
00222       double height;     //!< geodetic height                  [m]
00223       double x;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00224       double y;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00225       double z;          //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00226 
00227       x = atof( argv[4] );
00228       y = atof( argv[5] );
00229       z = atof( argv[6] );
00230 
00231       GEODESY_ConvertEarthFixedCartesianToGeodeticCurvilinearCoordinates(
00232         referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []     
00233         x,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00234         y,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00235         z,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]  
00236         &latitude,            // geodetic latitude                [rad]
00237         &longitude,           // geodetic longitude               [rad]
00238         &height               // geodetic height                  [m]
00239       );
00240 
00241       if( echo_on )
00242       { 
00243         printf( "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ConvertEarthFixedCartesianToGeodeticCurvilinearCoordinates\n" );
00244         printf( "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00245         printf( "latitude  = %.12lf\n", latitude );
00246         printf( "longitude = %.12lf\n", longitude );
00247         printf( "height    = %.4lf\n", height );
00248         printf( "x         = %.4lf\n", x );
00249         printf( "y         = %.4lf\n", y );
00250         printf( "z         = %.4lf\n\n", z );
00251       }
00252 
00253       fprintf( fid, "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ConvertEarthFixedCartesianToGeodeticCurvilinearCoordinates\n" );
00254       fprintf( fid, "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00255       fprintf( fid, "latitude  = %.12lf\n", latitude );
00256       fprintf( fid, "longitude = %.12lf\n", longitude );
00257       fprintf( fid, "height    = %.4lf\n", height );
00258       fprintf( fid, "x         = %.4lf\n", x );
00259       fprintf( fid, "y         = %.4lf\n", y );
00260       fprintf( fid, "z         = %.4lf\n\n", z );
00261       break;
00262     }
00263     case 3:
00264     {
00265       double referenceLatitude;  //!< datum geodetic latitude  [rad]
00266       double referenceLongitude; //!< datum geodetic longitude [rad]
00267       double referenceHeight;    //!< datum geodetic height    [m]
00268       double latitude;           //!< geodetic latitude        [rad]
00269       double longitude;          //!< geodetic longitude       [rad]
00270       double height;             //!< geodetic height          [m]
00271       double northing;           //!< local geodetic northing  [m]
00272       double easting;            //!< local geodetic easting   [m]
00273       double vertical;           //!< local geodetic vertical  [m]
00274       
00275       referenceLatitude = atof(argv[4]);
00276       referenceLongitude= atof(argv[5]);
00277       referenceHeight   = atof(argv[6]);
00278       
00279       latitude = atof(argv[7]);
00280       longitude= atof(argv[8]);
00281       height   = atof(argv[9]);
00282   
00283       GEODESY_ComputeNorthingEastingVertical(
00284         referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00285         referenceLatitude,  //!< datum geodetic latitude  [rad]
00286         referenceLongitude, //!< datum geodetic longitude [rad]
00287         referenceHeight,    //!< datum geodetic height    [m]
00288         latitude,           //!< geodetic latitude        [rad]
00289         longitude,          //!< geodetic longitude       [rad]
00290         height,             //!< geodetic height          [m]
00291         &northing,                //!< local geodetic northing  [m]
00292         &easting,                 //!< local geodetic easting   [m]
00293         &vertical                 //!< local geodetic vertical  [m]
00294         );
00295 
00296       if( echo_on )
00297       { 
00298         printf( "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ComputeNorthingEastingVertical\n" );
00299         printf( "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00300         printf( "reference_latitude  = %.12lf\n",  referenceLatitude );
00301         printf( "reference_longitude = %.12lf\n",  referenceLongitude );
00302         printf( "reference_height    = %.4lf\n",   referenceHeight );
00303         printf( "latitude            = %.12lf\n",  latitude );
00304         printf( "longitude           = %.12lf\n",  longitude );
00305         printf( "height              = %.4lf\n", height );
00306         printf( "northing            = %.4lf\n",   northing );
00307         printf( "easting             = %.4lf\n",   easting );
00308         printf( "vertical            = %.4lf\n\n", vertical );
00309       }
00310 
00311       fprintf( fid, "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ComputeNorthingEastingVertical\n" );
00312       fprintf( fid, "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00313       fprintf( fid, "reference_latitude  = %.12lf\n",  referenceLatitude );
00314       fprintf( fid, "reference_longitude = %.12lf\n",  referenceLongitude );
00315       fprintf( fid, "reference_height    = %.4lf\n",   referenceHeight );
00316       fprintf( fid, "latitude            = %.12lf\n",  latitude );
00317       fprintf( fid, "longitude           = %.12lf\n",  longitude );
00318       fprintf( fid, "height              = %.4lf\n", height );
00319       fprintf( fid, "northing            = %.4lf\n",   northing );
00320       fprintf( fid, "easting             = %.4lf\n",   easting );
00321       fprintf( fid, "vertical            = %.4lf\n\n", vertical );
00322       
00323       break;
00324     }
00325     case 4:
00326     {
00327       double elevation=0;  //!< elevation angle [rad]
00328       double azimuth=0;    //!< azimuth angle   [rad]
00329       double fromX = atof( argv[4] );
00330       double fromY = atof( argv[5] );
00331       double fromZ = atof( argv[6] );
00332       double toX = atof( argv[7] );
00333       double toY = atof( argv[8] );
00334       double toZ = atof( argv[9] );
00335 
00336 
00337       GEODESY_ComputeAzimuthAndElevationAnglesBetweenToPointsInTheEarthFixedFrame(
00338         referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00339         fromX, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point X component [m]
00340         fromY, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point Y component [m]
00341         fromZ, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point Z component [m]
00342         toX,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point X component   [m]
00343         toY,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point Y component   [m]
00344         toZ,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point Z component   [m]
00345         &elevation,  //!< elevation angle [rad]
00346         &azimuth     //!< azimuth angle   [rad]
00347       );
00348 
00349       if( echo_on )
00350       { 
00351         printf( "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ComputeAzimuthAndElevationAnglesBetweenToPointsInTheEarthFixedFrame\n" );
00352         printf( "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00353         printf( "fromX     = %.4lf\n",  fromX );
00354         printf( "fromY     = %.4lf\n",  fromY );
00355         printf( "fromZ     = %.4lf\n",  fromZ );
00356         printf( "toX       = %.4lf\n",  toX );
00357         printf( "toY       = %.4lf\n",  toY );
00358         printf( "toZ       = %.4lf\n",  toZ );
00359         printf( "azimuth   = %.12lf\n",  azimuth );
00360         printf( "elevation = %.12lf\n",  elevation );
00361       }
00362 
00363       fprintf( fid, "GNSS_ESSENTIALS:GEODESY_MAIN::GEODESY_ComputeAzimuthAndElevationAnglesBetweenToPointsInTheEarthFixedFrame\n" );
00364       fprintf( fid, "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[ellipse] );
00365       fprintf( fid, "fromX     = %.4lf\n",  fromX );
00366       fprintf( fid, "fromY     = %.4lf\n",  fromY );
00367       fprintf( fid, "fromZ     = %.4lf\n",  fromZ );
00368       fprintf( fid, "toX       = %.4lf\n",  toX );
00369       fprintf( fid, "toY       = %.4lf\n",  toY );
00370       fprintf( fid, "toZ       = %.4lf\n",  toZ );
00371       fprintf( fid, "azimuth   = %.12lf\n",  azimuth );
00372       fprintf( fid, "elevation = %.12lf\n",  elevation );
00373 
00374       break;
00375     }    
00376     default:
00377     {
00378       break;
00379     }
00380   }
00381 
00382   fclose(fid);
00383 
00384   return 0;
